intro: Trichomanes borbonicum, commonly known as the Bourbon maidenhair fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, finely divided, and often hairy fronds. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Its intricate structure and unique morphology make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires careful protection.
